intro: Pluchea alata, commonly known as the winged false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and grassy areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are clustered in a flat-topped arrangement. Pluchea alata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
